TextView.android:text: Dennis Rirchie: Founder of C language

C is a general-purpose, high-level language that was originally developed by Dennis M. Ritchie to develop the UNIX operating system at Bell Labs. C was originally first implemented on the DEC PDP-11 computer in 1972. In 1978, Brian Kernighan and Dennis Ritchie produced the first publicly available description of C, now known as the KR standard.

 The UNIX operating system, the C compiler, and essentially all UNIX application programs have been written in C. C has now become a widely used professional language for various reasons:
 *Easy to learn
 *Structured language
 *It produces efficient programs
 *It can handle low-level activities
 *It can be compiled on a variety of computer platforms
